method.name: Retype
method.brief: Retype an untyped object
method.description:
Given a capability, , to an untyped object, creates of the requested type. Creates capabilities to the new objects starting at in the CNode specified by , , and .
For variable-sized kernel objects, the argument is used to determine the size of objects to create. The relationship between and object size depends on the type of object being created. See for more information about object sizes.
See for more information about how untyped memory is retyped.
See for more information about the placement of capabilities to created objects.

param.name: type
param.description: The seL4 object type that we are retyping to.

param.name: size_bits
param.description: Used to determine the size of variable-sized objects.

method.name: SetBreakpoint
method.brief: Set or modify a thread's breakpoints or watchpoints. Calls to this function overwrite previous configurations for the target breakpoint. Do not use this with seL4_SingleStep: the API will reject the call and return an error. Instead, use seL4_TCB_ConfigureSingleStepping to configure single-stepping.

param.name: bp_num
param.description: The API-ID of a target breakpoint. This ID will be a positive integer, with values ranging from 0 to seL4_NumHWBreakpoints - 1.

param.name: vaddr
param.description: A virtual address which forms part of the match conditions for the triggering of the breakpoint.

param.name: type
param.description: One of: seL4_InstructionBreakpoint, which specifies that the breakpoint should occur on instruction execution at the specified vaddr or seL4_DataBreakpoint, which states that the breakpoint should occur on data access at the specified vaddr.

param.name: size
param.description: A positive integer indicating the trigger-span of the watchpoint. Must be zero when 'type' is seL4_InstructionBreakpoint.

param.name: rw
param.description: One of seL4_BreakOnRead, meaning the breakpoint will only be triggered on read-access; seL4_BreakOnWrite meaning the breakpoint will only be triggered on write-access, and seL4_BreakOnReadWrite meaning the breakpoint will be triggered on any access.

method.name: GetBreakpoint
method.brief: Read a breakpoint or watchpoint's current configuration.
method.return: A : Struct that contains , an seL4 API error value, , the virtual address at which the breakpoint will currently be triggered; , the type of operation which will currently trigger the breakpoint, whether instruction execution, or data access; , integer value for the span-size of the breakpoint. Usually a power of two (1, 2, 4, etc.); , the access direction that will currently trigger the breakpoint, whether read, write, or both and , which indicates whether or not the breakpoint will currently be triggered if the match conditions are met.

param.name: bp_num
param.description: The API-ID of a target breakpoint. This ID will be a positive integer, with values ranging from 0 to seL4_NumHWBreakpoints - 1.

method.name: UnsetBreakpoint
method.brief: Disables a hardware breakpoint or watchpoint. The caller should assume that the underlying configuration of the hardware registers has also been cleared. Do not use this to clear single-stepping: the API will reject the call and return an error. Instead, use seL4_TCB_ConfigureSingleStepping to disable single-stepping.

param.name: bp_num
param.description: The API-ID of a target breakpoint. This ID will be a positive integer, with values ranging from 0 to seL4_NumHWBreakpoints - 1.

method.name: ConfigureSingleStepping
method.return: A : Struct that contains , an seL4 API error value, , a boolean which indicates whether or not the breakpoint ID that was passed to the function, was consumed in the setup of the single-stepping functionality: if this is , the caller should not attempt to re-use until it has disabled the single-stepping functionality via a subsequent call to seL4_TCB_ConfigureSingleStepping with an argument of 0.

param.name: bp_num
param.description: The API-ID of a target breakpoint. This ID will be a positive integer, with values ranging from 0 to seL4_NumHWBreakpoints - 1.

param.name: num_instructions
param.description: Number of instructions to step over before delivering a fault to the target thread's fault endpoint. Setting this to 0 disables single-stepping.
